conclusion: Analyze the path of the light from the source, reflecting off the paraboloid, and passing through the lens.
The light source is at the focal point of a paraboloid, reflecting light parallel to the axis.
Light reflects off the paraboloid and travels parallel to the axis; only light above the axis passes through the lens.
The lens is a hemisphere with radius R and has a vertical diameter MN.
The refractive index of the lens is n = 4/3.
Apply Snell's law for refraction at the spherical surface with angles of incidence and refraction.
Since light enters perpendicular to MN, the angles of incidence and refraction are zero.
The path length inside the lens is equal to the diameter of the hemisphere, which is 2R.
The length of the transparent part of all the light entering perpendicular to MN on the lens spherical surface is 2R.
